story_title: CIA's Secret Role in the 1960s Counterculture Uncovered
original_story: [mysterious] In the 1960s, what if the CIA wasn’t just watching the counterculture but secretly funding it? The agency launched Operation CHAOS in 1967, aiming to infiltrate and disrupt anti-war movements. But documents suggest a twist: the CIA may have covertly promoted psychedelic drug use to study social control. Enter Timothy Leary, a Harvard psychologist turned psychedelic guru, who famously said, ‘Turn on, tune in, drop out.’ [pause:0.5s] As hundreds of thousands flocked to music festivals like Woodstock in 1969, did they unknowingly play into a larger experiment? [dramatic] Declassified documents reveal the CIA tested LSD on unwitting subjects, including military personnel, seeking to develop mind control techniques. This unusual partnership blurred the lines between rebellion and manipulation. [pause:1s] As the counterculture flourished, did the CIA let it thrive to gauge the limits of social freedom? [curious] So, who was really in control? Were we witnessing liberation, or a clever social experiment?
